Description: Tondo and stem sherd of Attic black-figured pottery little-master cup; interior: in tondo, black-figure decoration consisting of part of naked male hunter, possibly Orion (head and legs from below knee missing) walking right and holding a club in lowered right hand and a hare (marked with incised flecks) and fox (only haunch and top of hind legs remaining) over his shoulder; at right, undetermined decoration, probably of part of another hare; underside of bowl reserved with central red dot and circle; second red circle at junction with reserved inside of stem; brown band on stem where it flares to the resting surface; exterior glazed.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see also Lochin, C., in Lexicon Iconographicum Mythologiae Classicae VII. Zurich and Munich 1994, 78-80 s.v. Orion 2. For parallels regarding the subject matter, see the olpe British Museum 1867,0506.38, the cup 1909,0216.12 by Phrynos and the lip cup by the Tleson Painter 1867,0508.946.
